subject: Re: [junit] Counting junit test failures/errors
msgSnippet: ... No idea. You have the code, dive in and code up a storm. :-) ... Yes, that s the way it works. I m thinking it s by design, on the belief that you either
messageBody:
On 8/25/06, Greg Irvine <greg.irvine@...> wrote:
> Any suggestions on how I might count the total number of test failures and
> errors in a build in order to fail the build at a certain threshold rather
> than more 0 failures?

No idea. You have the code, dive in and code up a storm. :-)

> The <junit> task seems to only set a fail/error property and not the number
> of failures in a test case.

Yes, that's the way it works. I'm thinking it's by design, on the
belief that you either want the first thing that fails or everything
that fails. Generally, I suspect, a few things that failed would be
much less useful.

Simon

--
www.simonpeter.org
